text: Paul Warfield Tibbets, Jr (23 February 1915 â€“ 1 November 2007) was a Brigadier general for the United States Air Force from 1937 to 1966. Paul is famous for dropping the first Atomic bomb on Hiroshima in the B-29 Superfortress called Enola Gay. He was born in Quincy, Illinois. Tibbets died of heart failure after suffering a small stroke in Columbus, Ohio, aged 92.
